edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math.curve

Interface TimeWrapMode


  • public interface TimeWrapMode
    Interface to manage appropriate wrapping, clamping, etc behavior for indexing-based behavior.

    This is analogous to IndexWrapMode, but for times rather than indices; the primary difference is that valid values for indices are 0 <= i <= (size-1), however valid values for times are 0 <= i <= duration.

    (Advanced functionality).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TimeWrapMode CLAMP
      Clamps the input time, such that negative times will return 0, and times greater than the duration will return the duration.
      static TimeWrapMode REFLECT
      Reflects the input time, such that negative times are taken in absolute value, and times greater than duration move back down towards 0.
      static TimeWrapMode WRAP
      Wraps the input time, such that negative times will wrap to the "end", and times greater than duration will wrap back to 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double handle(double time, double duration) 

    • Field Detail

      • CLAMP

        static final TimeWrapMode CLAMP
        Clamps the input time, such that negative times will return 0, and times greater than the duration will return the duration.

      • WRAP

        static final TimeWrapMode WRAP
        Wraps the input time, such that negative times will wrap to the "end", and times greater than duration will wrap back to 0. (See the behavior of IndexWrapMode.WRAP).

      • REFLECT

        static final TimeWrapMode REFLECT
        Reflects the input time, such that negative times are taken in absolute value, and times greater than duration move back down towards 0. (See the behavior of IndexWrapMode.REFLECT).

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        double handle(double time,
              double duration)
